department: Fisheries and Oceans Canada / Canadian Coast Guard
description: This is a notice of proposed procurement.",
full_summary:
### Commercial Seaweed Production Tender Announcement

This tender announcement is for the procurement of commercial seaweed production services.

#### Background
Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) is responsible for managing Canada's fisheries and oceans resources and promoting economic growth in the marine and fisheries sectors.

#### Objective
This tender announcement seeks to collect data on commercial wild harvest and aquaculture production of seaweed in Canada.

#### Reason for Procurement
Wild harvest and aquaculture production of seaweed are regulated, but data available on production is scattered. Understanding the economic impacts of management and policy changes requires accurate and comprehensive data on the production and distribution of seaweed.

#### Scope of Work

* The successful bidder will be responsible for collecting and analyzing data on commercial wild harvest and aquaculture production of seaweed in Canada.
* The data will be used to support economic analyses and inform management and policy decisions.
* The bidder will also be required to provide detailed information on the geographic distribution of businesses that harvest and produce seaweed.

#### Tender Details

* Duration of Contract: March 6, 2024, to September 30, 2024.
* Timeframe of Delivery: March 6, 2024, to September 30, 2024.
* Tender Closing Date: February 19, 2024, at 14:00:00.

#### Selection Criteria
The successful bidder will be selected based on a combined rating of technical merit and price.

#### Trade Agreements
This tender announcement is open to contractors who are eligible under the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, and other relevant trade agreements.

#### Important Documents
The tender notice and relevant documents are available on the CanadaBuys website.

#### Contact Information
For more information, please contact Charles Nwachukwu at DFO.Tenders-Soumissions.MPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca or (902) 478-9713.
